first_reasoning: Allocating the $10 million to the Industrial Products Division offers the most reliable and timely path to restoring profitability. Focused R&D on cost-reducing materials and premium service modules can drive a clear two- to three-point margin improvement within 18–24 months, with well-understood execution risks. In contrast, the Consumer investment carries higher development risk, a longer three-to-five-year runway, and greater sensitivity to delays and cost overruns. Given the urgent need for a measurable earnings uplift in under two years, Industrial is the prudent choice.
second_reasoning: We are directing the full $20 million to the Industrial Products Division because its established channels and supplier partnerships make execution risk low and ensure a reliable payoff. With R&D focused on cost-reducing materials and premium service modules, we project a two- to three-point margin gain—translating into roughly $15–$20 million in additional operating profit by year two—even after allowing for modest delays or cost overruns. This clear, near-term return aligns with the board’s timeline and risk parameters, making Industrial the prudent choice.
